Interested in CS Opportunities?
Then this is the place for you! ðŸŽ‰

What is research in Computer Science? ðŸ¤”

You get to choose a specific area within computer science that you want to continue learning about. Like any other research paper, you investigate that topic and conclude your findings.

Want to learn more? Click here: http://conquer.cra.org/students/getting-into-research

Wellesley Science Summer Research Program ðŸ˜¯

This program employs students as full-time research assistants in a structured 9- or 10-week program. You receive a stipend and can use campus housing! The application window usually opens around the start of the Spring semester.

Want to apply? Click here: https://webapps.wellesley.edu/science_summer_research/index.php?cas=1

Independent research ðŸ¤“

Research Assistantship
It is a paid position! There is no fixed time frame, so you can start and end any time. You are employed through the college to help a faculty member with a research project. The amount of work you would be given varies from project to project. Note to remember: No academic credit is given in this position.

Independent Projects
You would be involved in academic or research work supervised by a faculty member for academic credit!

If you wish to do an independent project, you should find an advisor and register for CS250, CS250H, CS350 or CS350H. These courses are available to students who have taken CS230 or given permission of the faculty advisor. Important note: CS250 and CS350 are one-unit courses, while CS250H and CS350H are half unit courses.

Want more information? Click here: https://www.wellesley.edu/cs/research/independent

Honors Project ðŸ¤©

It is usually more substantial than the independent project. It spans over two semesters and leads to a Senior Thesis! The honors work is looked at by a college-wide committee, specifically, the Committee on Curriculum and Instruction.

Interested? Click here: https://www.wellesley.edu/cs/research/thesis

UROPs at MIT ðŸŒŸ

UROP, also known as, Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program, enables students to join research efforts of MIT faculty in multiple departments.

If you wish to enroll in a summer UROP for credit, you can do so using the cross-registration system. You would have to bring a completed cross-registered form to both Wellesley and MITâ€™s registrar offices. However, keep in mind that, for the summer UROP, you are required to pay the Wellesley Summer Session tuition for a one-unit course.

Tips for finding a UROP: https://urop.mit.edu/students/resources/tips/

Guidelines and Application deadline for Wellesley Students: https://urop.mit.edu/urop-for-wellesley-college-students/

For your information: The Science Center has no information about UROP at MIT, please check with the contacts below!

Still have questions? Contact:

  • MIT UROP Office, 7-104, 617.253.7306, urop@mit.edu
  • Wellesley Registrar's Office, Schneider Center First Floor, 781.283.2307

Honors Project ðŸ¤©

It is usually more substantial than the independent project. It spans over two semesters and leads to a Senior Thesis! The honors work is looked at by a college-wide committee, specifically, the Committee on Curriculum and Instruction.

Interested? Click here: https://www.wellesley.edu/cs/research/thesis

What are REUs? ðŸ™Š

REU, also known as, Research Experiences for Undergraduates, is a program that supports research participation by undergraduate students. The research can be done in any of the areas that is funded by the National Science Foundation.

Intrigued and need more information? Click here:
https://beta.nsf.gov/funding/opportunities/cise-research-experiences-undergraduates-sites

Summer Research Programs ðŸ˜„

You can also do summer research at different Colleges and Universities! In the link below, there are a list of programs that may interest you. These programs generally offer a stipend and sometimes housing!

Click here:
https://conquer.cra.org/students/getting-into-research/finding-opportunities

Distributed Mentor Project ðŸ˜¸

This program aims to increase the number of women entering their graduate studies, specifically, in the fields of computer science and engineering. It is a great opportunity that allows a view of what graduate school is like.

Curious? Click here for more: https://cra.org/cra-wp/

With all that being said,

Best of luck!

Contact Us


This site is only possible through the efforts of students and educators like you. If you have a resource you think could be added to the page, an idea for a page on TransparenCS, or any critiques, suggestions, funny memes, questions, or poems, please contact us!
